Clues in the vault unravelled some of the dark secrets he kept during his lifetime, and the characters should have determined that his wife Amelia was captured by Lisette and held prisoner somewhere. This adventure expands on these clues and secrets as the characters attempt to find out what really happened to Amelia and bring her back -- if she is still alive.

The Quest for Amelia is designed for 4 characters of 2nd -3rd level and takes place within the town of Weston (as detailed in NeMoren's Vault) and the small forest located directly northwest of it. This area should be easy to drop into an existing campaign; even the minotaur's cave can be placed in any type of terrain; the dryad encounter, however, will need to be removed if the cave is not located in a forested area.

130273.name: West Point A Game For The Nation
130273.description:
The game is a rather simple roll and move game. It has 43 spaces arranged in a triangle. Some spaces are marked with a cannon ball or a star. The cannon ball marked spaces are penalty spaces. Lose a turn, go back spaces and so on. the star marked spaces predict good fortune for the player but bestow no advantage in the game itself.

The game uses one six sided die (1-6) for determining the number of spaces to move. The game sample has two dice cups so there may have been more than one die originally. The markers are red, black, yellow, and green.

The game box is mostly red with the title in yellow. A West Point Cadet in full dress is standing at attention with a bayoneted musket.

130274.name: Die Kerker von Grimmstein (Version 1)
130274.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seit Jahrhunderten werden hier die gefürchtetsten und skrupellosesten Verbrecher, unliebsame Adelige, Freidenker und Schwarzmagier eingekerkert und sich selbst überlassen. Die genaue Position Grimmsteins ist nur wenigen Herrschern und den obersten Priestern Caeras bekannt, deren Insassen von den Grimmwächtern – einer geheimen Gilde aus Kriegern und Judikatoren, die durch die Länder rund um die Innersee streifen – seit vielen Generationen hierher gebracht werden.

Nur wer jemals den Ausgang des Gefängnisses erreichen sollte, würde seine Freiheit zurückerlangen. Bislang ist dies allerdings noch niemandem gelungen.


Translation courtesy of Google:

For centuries, here the most feared and ruthless criminals, nasty nobleman, freethinkers and Black Mage imprisoned and left to themselves. The exact position Grimm stone is only a few rulers and the chief priests Caeras known the occupants of the Grimm guards - a secret guild of warriors and Judicator that roam through the lands around the Innersee -. Brought here for many generations.

Only those who should ever reach the exit of the prison, would regain his freedom. So far, however, this is no one company.

130275.name: Die Kerker von Grimmstein (Version 2)
130275.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seit Jahrhunderten werden hier die gefürchtetsten und skrupellosesten Verbrecher, unliebsame Adelige, Freidenker und Schwarzmagier eingekerkert und sich selbst überlassen. Die genaue Position Grimmsteins ist nur wenigen Herrschern und den obersten Priestern Caeras bekannt, deren Insassen von den Grimmwächtern – einer geheimen Gilde aus Kriegern und Judikatoren, die durch die Länder rund um die Innersee streifen – seit vielen Generationen hierher gebracht werden.

Nur wer jemals den Ausgang des Gefängnisses erreichen sollte, würde seine Freiheit zurückerlangen. Bislang ist dies allerdings noch niemandem gelungen.

Grimmstein – The Deeper Levels
Und weiter geht es mit Stefan Bushuvens Grimmsteiner Fanwerkprojekt:
Neben speziellen Setting-Regeln für sein auf Caera angesiedeltes Mega-Dungeon sind im aktuellen Update auch zahlreiche neue Ebenen enthalten – von den tiefen Kerkern über die Asservation und dem Magazin bis hin zur alten Garnison wartet jede Menge Dungeon darauf, von Euch geslayed zu werden.
Zudem verrät das Tagebuch des Odan Marr so einiges über den Hintergrund und die Entstehungsgeschichte der Kerker von Grimmstein.


Translation courtesy of Google:

For centuries, here the most feared and ruthless criminals, nasty nobleman, freethinkers and Black Mage imprisoned and left to themselves. The exact position Grimm stone is only a few rulers and the chief priests Caeras known the occupants of the Grimm guards - a secret guild of warriors and Judicator that roam through the lands around the Innersee -. Brought here for many generations.

Only those who should ever reach the exit of the prison, would regain his freedom. So far, however, this is no one company.

Grimmenstein - The Deeper Levels
And on it goes with Stefan Bushuvens Grimm Steiner Fanwerkprojekt:
In addition to special setting rules for its on Caera located somewhere mega-dungeon are in current update include many new levels - from the deep dungeons of the Asservation and the magazine up to the old garrison waits each Dungeon amount out of you to be geslayed.
also reveals the diary of Odan Marr thing or two about the background and history of the dungeon of Grimmenstein.

130276.name: Confetti
130276.description:
Designer Sergey Machin has created a game in a completely new genre – the active party game – with the name coming from a traditional Russian new year's entertainment for kids and adults alike: Confetti.

The point of the game is simple. We toss half the deck on the table, sit down, then while the hourglass runs try to create different card combinations that bring us victory points (VPs).

One side of a Confetti card shows three differently sized and colored circles; by collecting cards with a small, medium and large circle of the same color, the player receives 1 VP. The other side has different shapes, but the idea is the same; a small, medium and large shape of the same color is worth 1 VP.

What makes the game tough is that you can take cards from the table only by using the fingers on your right hand and sliding them across the table. You'll also need to use your left hand to hang on to cards already taken or else other players can steal them from you. Finally, any cards you collect that aren't used in a combination with others cost you 1 VP at the end of the game. (Bear in mind that any shape on a card can be used in only one combo!)

Confetti lasts three rounds. During the first and second rounds you can collect and keep six cards in your play area; during the third round nine cards. In between rounds, you can keep some previously collected cards, specifically a number of cards equal to the number of VPs you scored in the previous round.

130277.name: Pantheonic Dreams: Ecology of Canton Volume 1
130277.description:
From Introduction:

"'Come into my parlor,' said the spider to the fly"

Now who would resist such a pleasant invite? The whole point of creating monsters is for interaction. You may want to defeat them, outwit them, or beat them into a bloody pulp, but the same monsters and the clutter of “additional traits” can get as tiresome as hearing your comrade in arms say “Ho there wanderer….” for the seventh time in the same game session.

The Ecology of Canton is a supplemental book of monsters providing new fodder for imaginations, player and DM alike. Each creature has a tie to the lands of the Pantheonic Dreams Realm Book, but can fit into any campaign through the Open Gaming License and the D20 system.

Our efforts in this endeavor were to provide something that has gone missing for some time in our experiences. Frivolity, laughter and humor. Everything we saw was a type of “fight it, or fear it” opponent, and our roleplaying would boil down to stabbing, spellblasting or running through the adventure. In this book we wish to provide adversaries to be tricked, cajoled, or befriended, without removing the purity of pounding the enemy
into the dirt. More so, we wished to provide that momentary smile elicited just from reading the book. More often than not, those spurs provide the ideas to drag players into more and better adventures.

130278.name: Pantheonic Dreams: World of Canton Main Realm Book
130278.description:
From Introduction:

Pantheonic Dreams is a stand-alone realm book base upon Open Gaming License and the D20 system. An entire world filled with new content awaits your perusal. As a player, we suggest not ruining it for yourself, and bullying your DM into buying the book so you can commence a whole new gaming experience. As a DM, this book will set you and your players off upon a whole new era not seen yet in the gaming world. The book is designed to immerse fantasy roleplayers into a world originating from other roleplayers.

The Pantheonic Dreams book provides vivid details on races, prestige classes, nations, politics and magic. A world generated with world locations for almost any player’s interests. Refusing to give up the old feeling of adventure and exploration, each part of the world is described only sufficiently to provide DM’s a structure with which they can flesh out with their own details, instead of grinding out the same presentation repetitively.

130279.name: Plague Inc.

videogamehonor.24531: 2013 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee

130279.description:
Plague Inc. is a unique mix of high strategy and terrifyingly realistic simulation. Can you infect the world?
Your pathogen has just infected 'Patient Zero'. Now you must bring about the end of human history by evolving a deadly, global Plague whilst adapting against everything humanity can do to defend itself.

Source: The Publisher Website.

130280.name: The Weekly Delver Volume 43, Issue 1
130280.description:
From Introduction:

Earthquakes are common on Thraxis, because of Arril, the massive moon that looms in the sky. Characters may frequently find that the earth shakes at inopportune moments. In an earthquake, a character is safest in two places, out in the open, or within a structure. Smart characters stay away from loose, heavy objects that can fall on them. The GM must determine the strength of the earthquake in terms of how much damage it does to structures. All buildings and structures (such as roads) are dealt this amount of damage every round, for the duration of the quake. If damage overcomes a structure’s hardness, pieces fall from it, possibly damaging anyone below. Quaking buildings threaten an area around themselves equaling their height. Anyone within these squares must make a reflex save or take damage from falling objects. Keep in mind as well that the earth itself is taking damage, for the duration of the earthquake, and if its hardness is overcome, fissures might open, possibly adding lava to the threats.

130281.name: The Weekly Delver Volume 43, Issue 2
130281.description:
User summary:

A discussion on daily life in Tobran, trade amongst countries, new equipment, and monsters.

130282.name: The Weekly Delver Volume 43, Issue 3
130282.description:
User summary:

A discussion on threats to Brend, daily life in Tobran, and monsters.

130283.name: The Weekly Delver Volume 43, Issue 4
130283.description:
User summary:

A discussion on threats from Canticle, and festivals and gods of Quetapanii.

130284.name: Revised Artificer Class and Rules Addenda
130284.description:
From Introduction:

The artificer has proven to require clarification and revision after several months of play. Several people have mentioned to me that while it is a great NPC class, there is little incentive to play one as a PC. Since the artificer is such an important class in Morningstar, I wanted to change that. Though the changes below are relatively small textually, the class is altered significantly.
In addition, there are some new rules and ideas to help you make the most of your play as an artificer, or to make your artificer NPCs more interesting. Enjoy!

130285.name: Japanese Castle
130285.description:
Calmness and concentration.
Just one right motion and the card will be fixed in the needed position.
Step by step, card by card – in front of you a fragile and elegant tower of a Japanese castle appears.

Japanese castle is a three-dimensional meccano and a competition of skill and accuracy. Laconic fascination of traditional Japanese architecture, ancient European card-building passion and a native Russian talent of constructing magnificent edifices without any nail are united in this game.

The game concept is familiar to everyone who has built a card castle at least once: vertical piers are leaned together and horizontal cards are placed at their top becoming a base for the new floor, and it continues till there are no cards left or one clumsy movement ruins all the construction. Moreover standard cards called heki which are used only for walls there are some other building elements: gamen screens (twice bigger than heki) and yanegae overlaps with the special fixed stops for heki. Vertical cards stay at their places because of it so castle levels can be built as a tower one right above another, not only like a pyramid. Yanegae cards are of two sizes – small ones with the space for one leaned pair of heki (this construction is called karigoya) and big for two pairs which can be placed transversely to each other as well as parallel. The last variety of big yanegae with two perpendicular pairs is called antei and works as the basic unit for the most of constructions.

Rules offer many varieties of the game: for one player or for the company of 2-4 builders. There can be up to 8 players if two game kits are used. Solo gameplay is simple – you need to build a castle as high as possible. There are no strict rules – you can use any element conditionally to your imagination. Competing versions usually offer to build a tower of exact height in a pelter or make the most solid building – in this case players jolt the table trying to ruin opponent’s castle and not to damage own. Especially amusing version tenders to take your castle and move it to another table keeping it all-of-a-piece, of cause. There is also some kind of gameplay resembling Jenga – players put some cards into a heap, place a few karigoya at the top and try to pull the cards out of the heap without busting the buildings.

Building castles with special elements is easier than with common cards but still the same interesting. Japanese castle can be even built by a child nevertheless nobody suggests to play it in the after-party morning.
The game differs favorably from the common cards by design – building elements show off the authentical Japanese pictures and interiors from the rich collection of the “Yugen” antiques gallery. Japanese castle will give you hours of creativity and excitement and maybe can become a first step to a high-altitude card building champion title for someone. Theoretically 5 Japanese castle game sets will be enough to build an eight-meter tower – the last registered record doesn’t haul a bit to this point.

130286.name: Volcano Island Countdown
130286.description:
You wanted a vacation. You’ve found an adventure. You’ve just arrived at Volcano Island. Instead of a tropical paradise, the island before you rumbles and shakes with a sinister force. You’ve heard the legend, and fear the worst: the magical Tiki has been released.

Players work together to find and return the four Guardian Totems to the volcano, and they must complete this task before the time on the volcano runs out. Rolling the die results in either movement of your player pawn, movement of the Tiki or drawing a tool card. Obstacle tiles, which are placed on top of the mystery tiles, are removed through having the correct tool cards. The mystery tiles are then flipped to either reveal a Guardian Totem, nothing, or an ambush by the Tiki.

130287.name: Bull's Eye: The Square Way to Success
130287.description: Bull's Eye is a simple roll-and-move played on a 7x7 grid printed on cardstock. The cells are numbered 1-48 and the very center one is labelled "BULL'S EYE". Players use the included pawns and single die to race around the spiral to the center. Four numbers have special instructions - lose a turn, go back four spaces, free throw and go ahead five spaces. An exact roll is required to enter the winning space. If one player arrives at a space that is already occupied, both players roll the die. The player with the highest number advances his pawn the number of spaces rolled.

130288.name: Trollbabe (Italian Edition)
130288.description:
from the editor's webpage

In a world were nordic saga and underground comic meet, lives the Trollbabe: neither human being nor troll, when she arrives in a place, things happens. In this game the fantasy genre goes back to its untamed roots and gives life to adventurous, exotic, action packed stories where powerful heroines change the world around them.

user comment
this Italian edition is full of new examples, explaination and revised rules. It also has a different layout and illustrations. Ron Edwards worked for long time with italian editors that asked him many question about the game, so the italian version is a lot more complete than the english version, more clear and with extended text.

130289.name: 123 Dice
130289.description:
123 Dice Game by Collective Wisdom

This small-box game has eight 1" dice with large numbers ranging from 1-72. Rules for 14 games and a few variations are included. All are math games designed for preschool through fourth grade. They are:

________________________________________
Preschool - 1st Grade:

Number Identification Game - Roll the dice and name the numbers, earning a point for each number correctly identified.

Order of Numbers Game - Roll all dice, re-rolling duplicates. Put the dice in numerical order. Earn one point per roll and play to five.

Counting Game - Roll all dice except the "81" die. Select any two dice and say aloud all the numbers between them. Earn one point per roll.
________________________________________
Games and Activities for 1st and 2nd Grades:

Another More Challenging Counting Game - Plays as "Counting Game" above except that a point is earned for each number named, encouraging players to select dice that are further apart.

Blind Toss Number Value Game - A moderator rolls all the dice and gives one to each player whose eyes are shut. Each player then goes around the circle, saying whether their number is greater than or less than each other player's die. If his is less than any player, he is eliminated. Eventually, one player will remain in the round and earn one point. This is repeated except that the lowest number will win the second round. Continue until a single player scores six.

Odd Even Game - Roll all dice and divide them into even and odd piles. Earn one point for each roll.

Addition Game (Adding 2 numbers) - Roll all dice. Select two, add them and announce the sum. One point is given for each correct answer. Play to ten points.

Addition and Subtraction - As above for Addition Game, but continue, subtracting the lesser die from the greater die and announcing the difference. One point is given for each correct answer. Play to ten points.

Addition Game (Adding 3 Numbers) - Roll all dice and choose three. Add them together and announce the sum.

Challenging Variation of Additiona & Subtraction Games - Instead of granting one point per correct answer, players earn the answer as the number of points, thus encouraging players to select harder dice.

Place Value Game - Roll dice until all show single-digit numbers. Select any three and name the three-digit number they form. Earn one point for each roll and play to 28. Optionally, offer an extra point for each number that is written out long-hand.

________________________________________
Games and Activities for 3rd and 4th Grades:

Multiplication Game I: Each player writes down a set of five numbers. Before rolling, each player will announce which of those numbers they will be using. After rolling all the dice, select three and multiply each by the number chosen before the roll, scoring one point per correct answer. On his next turn, the player must choose a new multiplicand.

Multiplication Game II: Roll six dice. Divide the rolled dice into three pairs and multiply each pair, announcing the product. Earn one point per correct answer.

Challenging Variation to Multiplication Games I and II: Play as above except that players add the products to their scores instead of one point, thus challenging them to select higher-yielding combinations.

Division Game: Roll all dice, removing any duplicate numbers. Identify any pairs of dice where one can be evenly divided into the other. Die may be used more than once. Earn one point per pair identified. Before the next player rolls the dice, they may review the pairs and earn two points for any missed pairs they identify. Play to 30 points.

Equation Game: Roll all dice. Identify any valid equations - addition, subtraction, multiplication or division. Each equation will require at least three dice, but may use more. Earn one point for each die used. Continue making equations, re-using dice as needed. Play to 25 points.

________________________________________
The dice are of good quality and have the following faces:

A: 1 - 2 - 3 - 4 - 5 - 6
B: 2 - 3 - 4 - 5 - 8 - 9
C: 2 - 9 - 10 - 10 - 11 - 12
D: 3 - 4 - 5 - 6 - 7 - 8
E: 3 - 5 - 6 - 7 - 9 - 10
F: 8 - 8 - 16 - 24 - 32 - 40
G: 9 - 18 - 36 - 54 - 72 - 81
H: 10 - 15 - 20 - 25 - 30 - 40

rpg.763: A Thousand and One Nights: A Game of Enticing Stories

130290.name: Le Mille e Una Notte
130290.description:
user summary

The italian edition of the game. It came out in 2010 in paperback with flaps, wrap-around cover, special iridescent paper.

The whole illustration where made anew by the artist Claudia Cangini. The edition and the illustrations where so good that the author of the game, game designer Meguey Baker, decided to launch a crowfunding campaign to have the english Second Edition made with the same arts and graphics.

In Italy the game is published by Narrattiva.

from the editors webpage

Mysterious strangers, enchanted swords, gorgeous women and talking camels. The member of the Sultan’s court spend their nights telling each other stories and, at the same time, they fight to achieve their ambition.
This volume’s cover and interiors are printed in two colour on iridescent paper.

user comment
this Item has a wrap around cover

130291.description:
The arm of the Empire is expanding and its next colony will be on the lunar surface. The only thing in the way of progress is the pesky natives. New rockets are being assembled and the call has gone out for brave leaders to captain these metal flying machines and annex the moon.

Players bid for parts, build their rockets, and then blast their way into space. They can battle lunar natives, found colonies, and construct a flying fortress. All the while they are competing against other players for prestige and the title of Grand Admiral of Her Majesty's Rocket Corps.

Her Majesty's Rocket Corps is a steampunk themed board game based on lunar conquest. Players acquire space ship parts from the auction, build their their rockets, combat the lunar natives, and start lunar colonies.

Join the Rocket Corps and see the solar system!
130291.name: Her Majesty's Rocket Corps

130292.name: Apocalypse: Zombie Edition
130292.description:
Description:
The zombie hordes have swept the world, humanity is barely hanging on, now is your chance to rule!!
All you have to do is survive, horde your resources and then find a nice mall or small town that you can rule with an iron fist. Fight zombies, sabotage your fellow survivors and ensure that you are the on top when all the undead dust settles.
Apocalypse is an exciting new collectable card game, where 2 or more players take turns battling zombies, gathering resources, and stabbing each other in the back. Find items like food and weapons, use zombie bait on your opponents, refresh yourself with the world's most aggressive energy drink, Prison Rape brand energy drinks. Expand your Apocalypse with the upcoming set Going Nuclear! The zombies are only the beginning.

2-4 players recommended for a 60 card deck, for more players just add more cards.

130293.name: Sporchi Segreti
130293.description:
From the editor's webpage

Noir stories of betrayal, murder and deceit

With Sporchi Segreti noir / hard boiled stories in the best tradition of Raymond Chandler, James Ellroy and Dashiell Hammett are created. Corruption, betrayal, murder and deceit are framed by a subjective camera in the point of view of a single protagonist looking for truth.

User comment

Default game setting is "your city, a week ago". So, according with the author of the game, the italian edition of Dirty Secrets has some changes in rules in order to adapt to italian society.

130294.name: Monster Crabs
130294.description:
From Kickstarter Web Site
Monster Crabs is a card game. It combines war with rock, paper, scissors. First you deal all the cards out. There will be 16 different crabs in three different elements. Each player says offense or defense and then flips up the card after they said offense or defense at the same time. The person whose card has the highest value wins that round and gets the cards. If it is a tie, you see if it's air, fire or water type. Air beats water, water beats fire, and fire beats air. Those are the basic rules. A full rule set will be included in each box.

130295.description:
You are spellbound. As a novice mage leaving the tower for the first time, you thought you were invincible. Taking on evil Baba Yaga the witch was, perhaps, not a good idea. Her hands became a blur, her mouth moved and her spell hit you between the eyes. It was two days before you woke up, four days before you could speak, and seven days before you remembered your name. No whisky was even involved. Some parts of your body have been enlarged – and some shrunk. Shoes are going to be expensive for sometime. The less said about your nose, the better. It is now time to take matters into your own (now quite large) hands.

The Spell de Spiel is hidden in spellbooks scattered throughout the land. Find the books and cast the spell, and you can banish the witch and return to your normal size. However, watch out! The witch is powerful. Maybe the good creatures of the land will come to your aid. Centaurs may gallop, dragons may fly, and even the crusty old librarian could research some dusty tomes. Vampires, for once, are keen to get their teeth into the action. Even the truculent dwarves might arrive in time to help (with their small-man syndrome axes). You need to act now. The witch grows ever stronger. Skeletons and goblin spider-riders are not traditionally known for their sense of humor. Can you recover the spellbooks, defeat the Witch and her allies, and have bards sing your praises for evermore?

It is a time for justice, a time for change, a time for heroes. With big feet. And big noses. Spellbound – the story is yours for the telling...

Spellbound, a co-operative, deck-building game playable in one hour for 1-4 players, is Fragor Games' Spiel 2012 release with 1,000 copies available. (Note: This game is an English language edition due to some of the cards having English text. German rules will be made available with card translations.)
130295.name: Spellbound

130296.description:
Even a racing super-star has time to sit down to a game of Super Dungeon Explore. Princess Malya brings her love of speed into the Last Galaxy's favorite online game, zipping through the dungeon at a breakneck pace. Malya slays monsters with glee, but is always willing to lend fellow adventurers a hand with the help of some creation magic.

Contents:
Princess Malya Hero Model
25mm Base
Game Card
130296.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Princess Malya

130297.description:
Explosions! Calico Kate bursts into Super Dungeon Explore to the boom of her trademark love of mass destruction. Her pirating skill ensures that she can plunder the best loot from even the stingiest dungeon minions.

Contents:
Calico Kate Hero Model
20mm Base
Game Card
130297.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Calico Kate

130298.name: Where in Space is Carmen Sandiego?
130298.description:
The intention of this game is to teach astronomy. The player flies in a rocket ship throughout the solar system, interrogating various alien lifeforms in order to solve the theft of an important part of the solar system (e.g. Saturn's rings). There was only a limited amount of fuel available for travel. So if the player didn't ask the right questions on the right planets, or followed the wrong clues, the criminal(s) would get away, leaving the player to start over again with another crime. This version is somewhat similar to Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego?. Kneemoi was introduced in this installment.

Source: Wikipedia, "List of Carmen Sandiego products", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

130299.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 42 - Apr 2012)
130299.description:
Make Your Way in a World of Gray

The shadows from the streaks of rain form lines like prison bars across the wall of your office. Who can you trust in this questionable world? Only yourself . . . and Pyramid, the PDF magazine for roleplayers. This month we turn our black-and-white gaze on the world of noir:


"The Zephyr Club," an adventurous locale for any mostly modern milieu. Written by Matt Riggsby (author of GURPS Locations: The Tower of Octavius and others), this place includes magnificent maps plus key GURPS details for its staff. The Zephyr Club is a great place to begin a memorable adventure . . . or end it!
"The Gameable Bouncer," a look at a timeless profession. In addition to the basics of the biz, this guide to keeping the private-club peace includes three GURPS templates.
"Human, Flawed" -- a collection of eight GURPS supporting-cast members that might populate a hard-boiled world. Your mean streets will come alive when you have a cynical politician, a plucky young reporter, a neutral gangster, and more at your fingertips!
"The Gathering Will," a ready-to-use plot device for bringing together those solitaire noir heroes . . . and keeping them together, 'til death do they part!
"The House of the Sun," a den of iniquity, intrigue, and danger suitable for any campaign daring enough to add some 1930s San Francisco sin to their shadowy setting.
"The Femme Fatale," an exploration of an old and ominous trope, complete with a look at some GURPS traits that are most suitable for this mischief-maker.


This Pyramid also presents a criminal Murphy's Rules with Greg Hyland, plus Steven Marsh's rain-soaked Random Thought Table. Let this issue's illumination help you out of the dark . . . and into the world of noir!

130300.name: The Golden Wombat of Destiny
130300.description:
A text adventure by Huw Collingbourne

Manual

The parser is not one of the most sophisticated the world has ever known ( nor, to be truthful, is it one of the least sophisticated the computer adventure game has ever known! ). It understands a fairly rigidly fixed grammar and doesn't have a lot of time for unnecessary adjectives. It rarely accepts plurals. Although 'trees' would be OK, 'wombats' and 'mice' most definitely are not! Also, you may only use one complete command at a time. "Put the small bottle on the ground" is fine, but "Put the small bottle on the ground and open it." isn't. This goes for taking and dropping things too. Get everything one at a time and don't try the old trick "take all" (often used by sneaky adventurers to fool a game into generating a list of significant objects - 'You can't take the axe, you can't take the sword' etc.), because this game doesn't let you get away with that!

If you don't care for all these restrictions, there are, nevertheless, some positive points too. Unlike many other games, The Golden Wombat will rarely reject an input command simply because there are one or two words that it does not understand. If possible, it will always try to make some sense of input although this may mean that it has to check that you really did mean to say what it thinks you meant. For example, you might type in: "Listen to the acrobatic little wombat." The game will politely(ish) inform you that it didn't understand all the words you used, but: "Do you want to listen to the wombat? ...Y/N" If you type 'Y', then the noises the wombat is making will be revealed in all their wonderment. If you type 'N', then you will be free to go on and do something more boring. If you type in "I wandered lonely as a cloud that floats on high o'er vale and hill," you are likely to generate a less sympathetic response!

130302.name: Pathways (Issue 18 - Sep 2012)
130302.description:
Cover by Joe Shawcross.

From the publisher's website:

You'll find articles by Michael Welham (Rpg Superstar and #30 Badges of Faith) Steven D. Russell (101 Not So Simple Templates), Creighton Broadhurst (Raging Swan Press), Thomas LeBlanc (#30 Battle Standards), Will Myers and Nathan Land (AdventureaWeek). Including Cartography by Todd Gamble (AdventureaWeek). Also you will find the top products with reviews by Endzeitgeist, and an interview with Stan! of Super Genius Games.

130304.description:
Dux Britanniarum is a table top miniatures wargame by the Too Fat Lardies.

Dux Britanniarum is a set of rules for wargaming and campaigning in the Age of Arthur. Covering the period 450AD to 600AD the rule book combine all you need to fight tabletop games and to run a virtually paper-free campaign.

The rules are designed to be played with relatively small forces. A Saxon starter Army is just 38 figures, a British starter army is only 44 figures, both of which can be purchased from our web site in 28mm although the rules play just as well with larger or smaller figures. Forces are grouped into six figures for most warriors and four figures for skirmish and missile troops or cavalry. The tabletop rules are D6 based and simple to use, with the single page playsheet on the rear cover of the rules covering 99% of situations. Activation is determined by a speedy card driven system where all units get to act in any single turn.

Included with the rules is an A3 pull out map of Britian in around 450AD which provides the background setting to the Dux Britanniarum campaign. Your characters start their campaign as a Saxon Lord or a Romano-British Tribune and will attempt to gain fortune and reputation on the battlefield as you fight to defend or conquer a Romano-British kingdom. Included with the rules are four detailed maps which together cover moderd Britain, Wales and lowland Scotland along with an historical background to each kingdom.

A character generation system will add colour to your campaign as your Nobles assume their own personalities. The terrain and scenario generator allows games to be set up quickly and to result in an almost infinite variety of games to keep you challenged and enjoying the action. The tabletop rules provide for a fast play system with a fun and exciting narrative as your Nobles lead their men into battle. The unique three phase battle system and force morale mechanism allows you to fight your battles with a minimum of preparation and tie those results into the campaign system for a really exciting and fun gaming experience.
130304.name: Dux Britanniarum

130305.name: Tinkle Bavard #31
130305.description:
Sin City, de Franck Miller
Contact personnel
Pour ne pas perdre le nord (suite)
Bienvenue sur Lishënil
Les eyldars sauvages
Civet de pigeons, sauce chasseur
Les univers inflationnistes
Tôkyô
Mariage à la tronçonneuse

130306.description:
Bob Morane

Carnet de notes
Le guide du routard cybernétique
Le Titanic, vie et mort d'un géant
Save Our Souls

Au théâtre ce soir
Confiousakat
Le dressage
Le Père Noël existe-t-il?
Les objets intelligents
Blanche IA & les sept nains
Les piliers de la terre, de Ken Follett

130308.name: Tinkle Bavard #34
130308.description:
Plume aux vents
Recherche voyageurs passionnément
Les pentacles
Concerto pour un nodule
Un petit village peut cacher de gros problèmes
Les Chroniques de la Dame de Fer

130309.description:
Tom Clancy
Les grandes orgues de Majister
Chasse au chasseur
Un autre genre de softwares
Le pacte
L'homme qui aimait les jeux super-héros

130311.name: Tinkle Bavard #36
130311.description:
Xoco, de Mosdi et Ledroit
La course
Le peuple centaure
Tombez petits flocons...tombez...
Des petits cauchemars...
Maara, ville martyre
L'étoile du désert, de Marini et Desberg
Mister Blueberry, de Giraud

130312.description:
Dan Simmons
Histoire à rebonds
Tombez petits flocons...tombez... (suite)
Logique floue
Meurtre à bord du Queen Hermine
La bibliothèque du mage

130313.description:
Cromwell Stone, d'Andréas
La dernière des Talawis
Un oeil dans le potage
Le samouraï virtuel
L'Alliance des Roseaux Verts
Mythes d'épouvantes
Dallas Barr, de Marvano et Haldeman

130314.description:
Weis & Hickmann
La dernière des Talawis (suite)
Loge le mercenaire
Vade retro corporis
Roues intelligentes
Disparitions & Néolithique
Le virtus et ses sources

130315.name: Tinkle Bavard #40
130315.description:
Teddy Bear
L'Oasis des Deux Lunes
A propos de l'improvisation
Vade retro corporis (suite)
Les Carnets secrets de W. Müller
L'aether

130316.name: Sunken Sydney
130316.description:
From the scenarios introduction:
What, who and why?

This is a oneshot Apocalypse World scenario called Sunken Sydney for an MC and 3-5 players. The name comes from the user "noofy" at the AW forums, but has nothing to do with that person otherwise. It was written as a collaborative effort by various people that hang around www.rollspel.nu.

The following people contributed to a larger or lesser extent: Arvid A. C. (project initiator), xyas, morkbollen, Poppe, Måns, Sodden.

Like "Blind-Blue & Hatchet city" this is sort of meant to be session 4 of an AW campaign. Love letters to each player containing custom moves set the tone and some of the background for the game.

130317.description: Slavika: Zmora, a promotional card for Slavika that's available at Spiel 2012, features Zmora – "Bane" in English – a monster that does not count against the monster limit in a location.
130317.name: Slavika: Zmora

130318.name: iBomber Defense Pacific
130318.description:
Get ready to take the battle to the enemy and win the war!

iBomber moves to the Pacific as you fight a whole new enemy across the Pacific to regain freedom.

Source: The Developer Website.

130319.name: The Playroom (1989)
130319.description:
This video game featured Pepper Mouse and was set in his playroom. Features included the spinner, which taught kids how to count; an ABC book, where kids could place objects wherever they wanted on the screen; the computer, which taught kids to spell; the cuckoo clock, which taught kids to tell time; the mousehole game, which was a dice-rolling game; and the mix-up toy, where kids could arrange heads, torsos, and legs from various characters to create others. A sequel to this game, called The Backyard, was released in 1993. It featured several new games, including tic-tac-toe, an animal matching game, and a clip art storybook illustrator that could save players' storybooks.
This game is a part of the Early Learning Family series of children's video games along with The Treehouse, The Backyard, and Kid Pix Deluxe.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Playroom", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

130320.name: The Treehouse
130320.description:
This video game was first released by Brøderbund Software in 1991 although most copies were sold in educational supply stores instead of mainstream stores that sold computer software. The game's main characters are two opossums who at different times either wanted to play or take a nap. The game has also featured several minigames and integrated encyclopedic content. Using a first-person perspective, The Treehouse is intended for an audience of toddlers and children in preschool. Lloyd Lightningbug and Casey are two of the non-player characters to interact with; with Lloyd acting as the player's nemesis while Casey acts like an emcee/advisor to the player.
It was re-released in 1996 for Windows versions 3.1 and 95. Although the Windows version has the same general activities, the characters, interface, and locations are different. As a product in the Early Learning Family Series, it was designed by the same people who made Kid Pix Deluxe, The Playroom and The Backyard.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Treehouse (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

130321.name: A Fistful of Penguins
130321.description:
In this quick, engaging dice game, players compete for points by rolling (and re-rolling) special animal dice. In late 2011, Crooked Smiles licensed the electronic rights to "A Fistful of Penguins" from its publisher, Wattsalpoag.

Source: The Developer Website.

130322.name: Monopoly: Wangerooge
130322.description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Wangerooge, an East Frisian island in Germany.

130323.name: Monopoly: Speyer
130323.description: Monopoly set in Speyer, one of the oldest cities of Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

130324.name: Monopoly: Passau
130324.description: Monopoly set in Passau,a city in south-east-Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

130325.name: Monopoly: Sauerland
130325.description: Monopoly set of the Sauerland, a German region. Due to good catering, winter sport region and short distance to the Netherlands menu cards are often written in Dutch, too (rare exception). All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

130326.name: The FORE! Horsemen
130326.description:
After the humans went and got themselves all Zombified, the Four Horsemen are left with lots and lots of free time. Following failed attempts at other leisure activities, they are giving mini-golf a try. Unfortunately, sportsmanship is a concept Death, War, Pestilence, and Famine have a difficult time grasping...

You and your fellow horsemen start the game on the first hole. Each turn you roll your bones and move by matching the symbols on the board. But, winning isn't easy against cheaters like the horsemen! Use your "FORE! stones" whenever you want to instantly knock another horseman's ball back to the last hole.

Win the game by being the first horseman to complete the 9th hole!

130327.name: Frankie
130327.description:
Franklin is the worse lab assistant EVER! Of course HE would be hit by lightning! How are you suppose to fire someone when he's just been fried!?!? The first step is putting him back together, and quickly too - you're going to need that lightning to restart the bone-head once you sew him back together... You did go to med-school right? Pre-med? Took home-ec? Oh no this isn't good at all... Man, did he just get hit AGAIN? Come on everyone, quickly now....

The game starts with that bone-headed lab assistant Frankie laying on the ground. The storm is raging and you're racing to put him back together before it passes. On your turn, pick a symbol, pick a partner to work with you, and roll your bones! If your combined roll shows the right combination, you have successfully mended one of Frankie's parts. Yay! If you don't, the storm keeps coming and the lightning rains down! But be careful, if more lightning hits Frankie before you're ready, some of your hard work will come undone!

Are your fellow scientists and co-workers missing in action? Well then it's up to you to fix Frankie all by yourself - roll all of the bones and with just a pinch of luck, you alone can put him back together!

Frankie is a co-operative game with all of the players working together against the storm tracker (timer). Win the game by successfully repairing all of Frankie's parts before the storm passes!

130328.name: Scared Sheet-Less
130328.description:
Moving into a new house is so exciting, especially one in a brand new neighborhood! People are moving in from all over the world... and so are the ghosts. Unfortunately, this town isn't big enough to contain so many spirits! The solution? Only the most scary, sheety ghost can stay. That's right, a real-life, astral scare-off! Thankfully, most of the new houses have full linen closets!

In Scared Sheetless, scaring is the name of the game! But let's face it, there's nothing scary about a naked ghost. The game starts out with you and your ghostly competitors alone in the new neighborhood, a neighborhood only big enough for one ghost. On your turn, roll your bones. Doubles reveal new sheets and the rest of your roll is movement. Match the symbols to move from house to house, picking up sheets and scaring your fellow ghosts as you go!

Win the game by being the last sheet-ed ghost!

130329.name: That's A Wrap!
130329.description:
Exploring a newly discovered tomb is so exciting! The hieroglyphs, the architecture, the sarcophagus... And... and the Mummy! Oh no, no no! Run! A brilliant idea, only foiled by the echoing thud of a dozen stone doors slamming shut! Need some keys. Oh man, keys, keys, keys! Quick!

The game starts off with you and your friends in the central chamber of a massive tomb - with the Mummy you just woke up! Oh no! Roll your bones and move as quick as you can because once he gets his bearings, the Mummy will be after you! You'll need to roll a key to pass through the locks and escape, but the mummy takes part of your rolls making those keys even harder to find!

The first person out of the tomb wins the game!

130330.name: Where-Wolf?
130330.description:
It's not easy being a werewolf, but you've learned how to make a life. Keep a low profile, don't chase the neighbors, etc... Unfortunately, it seems somewolf else hasn't learned that yet. And now the town's in an uproar over the mess left in the middle of town, and something must be done! The plan: head out into the woods on the next full moon and catch the wolf! The problem, everyone has to be there - including you! So you need to catch the other wolf before someone catches you. But what you don't know: your lovely town of Wolfeboro is inhabited entirely by werewolves and all of your neighbors are facing your same dilemma - catch or be caught!

Before the game begins, you and your friends must work together to create the Wolfeboro woods - every player gets a say in how many trees you use and where they go! Yay! And then its time to hunt down one of your friends before they can hunt you! Each turn, roll your bones to move, but be careful, the wrong roll means you get hit by moonlight and become the prey.

The first player to catch a w(h)erewolf wins the game!

130331.name: Zombified
130331.description:
Zombified is a 4-10 player elimination game.

Let's face it, there's no good explanation. You and your friends are locked in a silo with a broken jar of Zombie-Maker-243. The end result is a no-brainer: it's only a matter of time until you're all infected. But hey, why not make your last moments fun? After all, when it comes to tag, zombies really bite!

You and your friends start the game locked inside an abondoned military silo contaminated with Zombie-Maker-243. It's inevitable that you'll become a zombie, but that's not exactly the life choice that you prefer! Each turn, you roll your bones to run away from your (former) friends, but you'd better roll lucky: getting the wrong symbols means you've been contaminated and, BAM!, are instantly Zombified!

Zombified can also be played by groups even larger than 10 people! The central logo-staircase allows movement between the silo's underground floors. While there is no limit to the number of floors you can play on, a minimum of 5 people per floor is recommended.

The last player to become Zombified is the winner!

130332.name: The Stake-Out
130332.description:
The Stake-Out is a 2 player unequal-forces strategy game.

That darn Vampire has gone too far! With his flowing locks, eye-liner, and accent, he's setting the bar too high and the women-folk aren't willing to marry a simple guy anymore. They want poetry and compliments, charm and *ugh* romance! *shudder* Enough is enough! It's time for us villagers to stand together, put him in his place (and make sure he stays this time!)! He can't kill us all... right?

The Stake-Out starts with the Villagers pouring into the Vampire's lair and the unaware Vampire napping peacefully in his coffin. Moving slowly and staying out of the shadows, the Villagers need to surround the Vampire in order to stake their claim. The Vampire flies in shadows, taking out the villagers that stray too far from the group.

The Villagers win by surrounding the Vampire with at least 3 pieces. The Vampire wins by not being staked (and hopefully eating all of the Villagers!)!

130333.name: Middle Manager of Justice
130333.description:
Take control!
Manage an office of superheroes!

Recruit heroes!
Expand your operation by adding new heroes to your team.

Build your base!
Customize your base with different kinds of room. Each one serves a different purpose.

Manage your heroes!
Keep them busy working for you and fighting crime.

Fight crime!
Get criminals off the streets, one neighborhood at a time.

Save the world!
Face off against epic monsters.

Source: The Game Website.

130334.name: Them Bones
130334.description:
Them Bones is a 4 player perfect-information strategy game.

While the bone yard isn't a lively place, it's most definitely an active one, especially the underground scene! And all that activity has come to a head now that it's Halloween night. The Necromancer has returned to this unhallowed yard with his once-yearly promise to revive ONE skeleton. Factions have been established, lines drawn, and the fight is on! And you'll be damned if he picks somebony else AGAIN!

Them Bones starts off like any normal graveyard - with all of the skeletons in their graves. But the necromancer is coming and only ONE skeleton will get a second chance at life. You'll have to work together with your competitors to eliminate other skeletons, but it'll be up to you alone to take and hold the central Masoleum while the necormancer casts his spell. Don't forget to use of the graveyard's underground tunnel network to move between graves and get the jump on your competition!

Skeletons are captured by being surrounded by any two opposing skeletons (mixed-force captures are allowed!). The first player to capture and hold the center space for one full round wins the game!

130335.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 43 - May 2012)
130335.description:
The Magic Is Back!

Are you looking for more magic at the gaming table? This month's Pyramid -- the PDF magazine for roleplayers -- is there for all your eye-of-newt needs. This month we visit the topic of Thaumatology for the third time, with more magical alternates and tweaks to add that spark back into your life. This issue's mana-marinated morsels include:


"Adelphos Dionysos," a school of magic that follows the form of GURPS Thaumatology: Magical Styles. Written by GURPS giant Sean Punch, this style draws on the power of wine to give its practitioners power sublime!
"Cultists of the Elder Gods," a look at the followers of everyone's favorite GURPS Dungeon Fantasy freaks. These clerics are quick to prove that madness is a state of mind!
"Bottled Magic," an expansion of the Ritual Path magic options from GURPS Monster Hunters. With rules for potions, salves, and more, you won't think over these new options; you'll drink over them!
"Ghoul Magic," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Fourth Edition co-author David Pulver. Discover the GURPS Thaumatology rituals that will let you slake your appetite . . . by giving you a new appetite!
"The Missioners," a systemless group of mortal minds hoping to bring magic back into the world -- no matter the cost.
"Magic as Technological Progress," a different way of looking at the core GURPS Magic system. It's like tech levels . . . for spells!
"Real Weird Books," a primer on the perfect starting points for introducing actual arcane lore into any gaming situation.


This Pyramid also presents a mystifyingly mundane Murphy's Rules with Greg Hyland, plus Steven Marsh's crackling-fun Random Thought Table. When it comes to Pyramid issues devoted to magic, the third time's the charm!

130337.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 44 - Jun 2012)
130337.description:
Rules Made To Be Broken!

GURPS is designed to be the game system you want it to be, with a plethora of possibilities and options of all types. But sometimes, you want to push the system to strange new places. Sometimes you want to be radical or experimental. This issue of Pyramid -- the PDF magazine for roleplayers -- is for you. This month's theme is Alternate GURPS II -- a sequel to the wildly popular earlier installment. This month's highly optional boundary-breaking brilliance includes:


"The Last Gasp," an extensive overhaul of the core Fatigue Point system. Hit your wall more gracefully with systems for long-term fatigue . . . and use the new Action Point system to influence your moment-to-moment actions!
"From Skills to Advantages," a new system by GURPS mastermind Sean Punch that lets you add limited cinematic feats to your realistic campaigns. Discover abilities such as Healer's Touch or Eye of the Arcane!
"Colorless Green Ideas Sleep Furiously," a radical skill-based alternative to the core languages system for GURPS. Written by Roger Burton West (author of GURPS Reign of Steel: Will to Live), this feature includes an extensive table that showcases the relationships between every modern language with more than 3,000,000 speakers.
"Tactical Mass Combat," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Fourth Edition co-author David Pulver. These rules transform the system from GURPS Mass Combat into a counter-based, wargame-style tactical experience.
"Abstract Wealth," which transforms the core GURPS rules for dealing with money into a fast-paced Wealth attribute. Roll to see if you have the funds for that big purchase!
"Appendix Z: Survivable Guns," another David Pulver-penned tweak that looks at firearm damage. Maintain some realism while making it more feasible to survive without being draped in bulletproof armor.


This Pyramid also presents creepy-eyed aliens in Murphy's Rules by Greg Hyland, plus Steven Marsh's niche-protecting Random Thought Table. GURPS is only limited by your imagination -- and this month's Pyramid will push your imagination to new heights!

130338.name: Monopoly: 1899 Hoffenheim
130338.description:
Monopoly set of the soccer team TSG 1899 Hoffenheim, located at a village in southern Germany. Compared with other home bases of German teams like Hamburg, Munich... the size of the village is incredible small.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

130339.name: Of Montreal's Songun
130339.description:
A game that defies explanation, the ultimate goal being whatever you make it to be. Teams of 2-players take part in this party-style game by moving across a board and performing one of four actions from a specified deck of cards:

Mime Medium: help your partner guess the clues on the card by miming it to them

North Korean Trivia: guess the correct answer to a collection of erroneous and admittedly falsified questions

Illustrative Efforts: using drawing only, get your partner to guess the clues

Thespian Affronts: using any means necessary, except for saying the exact clues themselves, help your partner guess the clues on the card

Each team also has a collection of dominoes, which can be played after each card action is performed. The game being played with these dominoes should be agreed upon before the game starts (the rules recommend playing "double sixes"), and the scores should be kept track of on a piece of paper.

Whether the result of each card was successful or not, a word from the bottom of the card is written down, and at the end of the game the group tries to come up with a poem using these words.

The end of the game should be agreed upon by all players before starting, or by setting up a house rule to that effect.

130340.name: Monopoly: Ringhotels
130340.description:
Monopoly promotional set of Ringhotels, a German hotel chain of 19 participants.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

130341.description:
A Publisher-issued promo item for Run for Your Life, Candyman!

Includes the following 11 cards and a cover/ad card labeled
Run for Your Life, Candyman! Extra Special Treats:

100Gs Bar
B.B. Ruthless
Bite-Me-Honey
Frosting
Necrowafer
Nurds
Penny Candy
Sour Patchwork Kids
Spear Mint
2 blank Make Your Own Treat cards




All have Special Treat on the back.
130341.name: Run for Your Life, Candyman!: Extra Special Treats

130342.name: From Log Cabin To White House
130342.description: Each player takes one piece, and puts it on the Log Cabin. At the beginning of the game each player must spin a one to advance to the first square. All plays are made in turn, moving the number of squares spun with the dial. Each square represents an office, and a progress to the White House. If a player stops on a square indicating a promotion or a setback, the player moves forward or backward to the square named. If sent to the Log Cabin, the player must begin over again. If sent to Court the player removes his or her piece to the Jury corner, and spins in turn the Jury dial to get the verdict of the Jury. The player must abide by this verdict, doing as the dial directs. The player first reaching the White House at the centre, moving there exactly for his or her spin, will be President, and win the game.

130343.name: Monopoly: Niederbayern
130343.description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Niederbayern, a region in southern Germany.
remarks:
The city 'Straubing' (a pearl) belongs to Niederbayern and was busy - at that time - publishing its own city edition, a bit competitive to the region approach. The discussions around rose up in some (local) newspapers.

130344.name: Monopoly: Oberpfalz
130344.description: Monopoly set of Oberpfalz, a region in southern Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

130345.name: Monopoly: Oberursel
130345.description: Monopoly set in Oberursel, a city north of Frankfurt, Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

130346.name: Newport Yacht Race Game
130346.description:
IMPLEMENTS:
Two differently numbered yachts
An indicator with an arrow

Each player takes a yacht and the plays in turn, according to the rules.
Each player must spin a 5 to enter the yacht at space 1 but if later on he is compelled to start over again by stopping on either space 4 or 15 the player may enter on any spin.

If a yacht stops on a gold space it gains two points, going to the next gold space.

If a yacht stops on a red space the player loses his/her turn.

If two yachts wind up on the same space, the first yacht is "blanketed" and goes back 4 spaces.

If a yacht becomes disabled by landing on space 27 it moves forward at 1/2 spinner speed rounded up for the remainder of the game unless a 6 is rolled which repairs the yacht and then on the next turn the yacht returns to normal speed. Players stopping on spaces containing directions must always move according to those directions except for those landing on space 27 (disabled)

First player to reach space 40 wins the race

Game submission should be credited to KEVIN Kluvon KG who sent me the info on the game

130347.name: Fibber
130347.description: Did you see a ghost? Or are you fibbing? In Fibber, kids wear special glasses that can hold "nose" pieces and play picture cards in order, and then tell everyone what they're playing. If you don't have the next card in order, you must play a different card - but don't get caught fibbing or your nose will grow! When the silver nose piece is played the game ends and shortest nose wins the game!

130348.name: Spirits of Mystery: Song of the Phoenix
130348.description:
Reunite the Dragon and Phoenix Kingdoms in Spirits of Mystery: Song of the Phoenix. The Kingdoms of Dragon and Phoenix have been warring with each other for over 300 years. The Princess of the Dragon kingdom was set to wed the Prince of the Phoenix Kingdom in order to bring an end to the conflict but the Prince has been kidnapped! An evil witch, trapped in stone hundreds of years ago, orchestrated the abduction of the Prince. If the two Kingdoms cannot form a truce through matrimony, then the witch will break free from her prison. Help the Princess locate her missing groom and unite the two Kingdoms in this captivating Hidden Object game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

130349.name: Snark Busters: All Revved Up
130349.description:
Join Jack as he jumps between the real world and the inverted realms inside of mirrors in an attempt to catch his quarry. Solve dozens of whimsical puzzles to open the doors that lead to a bizarre fair, a steam punk airship, and a dinosaur museum; explore worlds of exquisite detail; and keep your eyes peeled for hundreds of cleverly hidden objects. Packed with mini-games, animated cinematics, and tappable surprises, Snark Busters: All Revved Up offers a ride you’ll never forget!

Source: The Developer Website.

130350.name: Snark Busters: High Society
130350.description:
Investigate the dastardly deeds of a wealthy socialite and prove your fiancé is not a thief in Snark Busters: High Society! Love, envy and revenge join forces to make the hunt for the Snark more exciting than ever in this all-new hidden object adventure! The day after world famous photographer Elizabeth Hughes announces her engagement to a handsome gardener named Nicolas Fortright, the wealthy Duchess Daffington accuses the young man of stealing a precious family heirloom. With her beloved behind bars, Elizabeth sets off to learn the truth.

Solve riddles that reveal pieces of the larger puzzle; follow the trail of clues through mirrors and into the backward world, where the Snark remains as elusive as ever; and chat with charming ghosts, each of which has a quest for you to solve. Stylish steampunk visuals bring the world of the Snark to stunning life, while the professionally voiced characters deliver a spellbinding story of humor and suspense. Can you catch the Snark? You're closer than ever!

Source: The Developer Website.

130351.name: Best 'N Show
130351.description: Simulates the dog show circuit life. Players roll a die and move, encountering various expenses and bonuses. At several points, you may participate in regional Dog Shows, possibly acquiring points (the rules are rather sketchy). Once you have 15 points, you may attempt to enter the Best Minster K.C. show in the center of the board, where you win the game if you correctly guess the [breed] Group which has won 'Best In Show'; if you do not win, you collect all the money on the board (how it gets there is not mentioned) and return to the circuit.

130352.name: Aloha: The Spirit of Hawaii
130352.description:
Aloha: The Spirit of Hawaii is about the story of Hawaii from the Polynesian migrations all the way through its journey to U.S. statehood in 1959. It's a game in which the theme and the mechanisms of play really tie together. You will guide your Pure Hawaiians, emigrating and settling in the Prologue. In the three main chapters of the game, you will migrate from island to island, vying for control of the islands and their resources such as commerce, aloha and people. You will be able to play event cards based on the history of the islands, and you will elect chiefs and kings and a even a queen. Between chapters you will score victory points and generate the actions necessary for success in the next chapter. In the Epilogue, all of your planning will come to fruition as you try to become elected governor, the most valuable position in the game.

The game takes 10-15 minutes to learn, and 60-90 minutes to play. It is recommended for ages 10 and higher. It plays well for 2,3 or 4 players due to the scaling of the scoring – to keep all the games tight and fast paced. The theme is inviting and a great experience for hobby gamers and those just getting into euro-style games.

130353.name: Hugs
130353.description:
Everybody needs a hug now and again! In Hugs, by designer John Poniske, you are a member of a big family and you love everyone. So how do you show your love to the members of your family? By giving them a lot of hugs!

Each time you hug a family member, you earn points, and the objective is to earn the most HUG points possible. Of course, some members enjoy more hugs than others, and then there are SOME things you want to avoid hugging altogether. But will you be able to tell the difference?

Each turn, a player has one of four actions to choose per turn: To place one of their colored HUG counters, remove a family token from the board, peek at other tokens on the board, or draw a token from the "Token Pool" and place it face-down on the board.
Not all tokens are good to hug, and some family members are worth more points than others! When all pieces from each player have been placed, each counter is flipped over and the points are counted where their HUG counter connects with any character tokens.

A great little kids game that the whole family will love, give some HUGS to you and yours today!

130355.name: Man of The Match
130355.description:
Man of The Match is a soccer card game that can be played by 2-4 players. Each player becomes a coach, manages a soccer team and competes against the other coaches' teams in order to win the Championship and Cup.

At the beginning of the game and after each match, the coaches buy and sell soccer players in order to create a strong and competitive team. The coach that handles better his economics, will sign in the new soccer star!

During the match the home team coach gets 6 Attack and 6 Defence cards and the away team coach gets 5 Attack and 5 Defence cards. The home team coach attacks first using one of his Attack cards and the away team coach tries to defend his team using one of his Defence cards. Then the away team coach makes his move using one of his Attack cards and the home team coach uses his Defence cards. Each Attack card describes an event, for example "Injury" or "Goal" or "Penalty" etc. and the Defence cards deactivate the Attack cards. When all attacks have ended, the coach who has scored more goals is the winner.

The game can be played for as many seasons as you like and never ends. Every match is different than the previous and this is what makes this game really exciting! One season lasts about 1 hour.

Man of The Match is a very entertaining, easy-to-play, fast and funny game which can be played by people of all ages. It is very addictive to those who love soccer, but people who don't even watch soccer show a lot of excitement playing it!

130356.name: Jungle Gold Game
130356.description: Players take turns spinning a spinner and moving the number of spaces shown. When they spin 'Return to Start', they do, and take the number of points shown on the space they're leaving, or lose 10 points if they were already on 'Start'. A few other spaces have other effects, and a player landing on an occupied space moves back two spaces instead. First to 250 points wins.

130357.name: Go First Dice
130357.description:
A set of four dice that will fairly determine who goes first in a game... or just a very simple game to itself. The four specially numbered twelve-sided dice have the following properties when rolled one against one another:

1. There will never be ties.
2. Each die always has an equal chance of rolling high. This is regardless of whether all four are rolled against one another, or ANY subset of 2 or 3 dice are rolled against one another.
3. The fairness extends to all permutations of lower positions too; meaning that the 2nd highest roll can fairly determine who should go second in a game, the 3rd highest roll determines third player, and so on.

130358.name: Time Heroes Alpha Playtest Scenario
130358.description:
From the website --

"Why Knot?" In their first mission as a group, the Time Heroes must get to Alexander the Great and discover what dark secrets Morgan La Fey holds that compels him to do her bidding...before it's too late.

130359.name: Aftermath! Magic!
130359.description:
From the back cover

200 years later... You can say the world has changed a bit. Dragons, Elves, Wizards and more - fighting it out with Dwarves and Orcs with guns and technology. Will you Choose the path of the Mystical? Or will you choose the Technological?

Aftermath! Magic! is the essential expansion to complete your Aftermath! collection. Filled with over 276 spells, mystical races, magic items, and more, Aftermath! Magic! allows you to adventure in the world after a magical collapse. What caused the collapse? Where did all these creatures come from? This is left for your players to find out.

130360.name: Deneb Sector
130360.description:
From the back of the book:

Deneb Sector

Continuing the great exploration of the Third Imperium, Deneb Sector provides new ground for your players to explore, colonise and capitalise!

Part of the Great rift, Deneb Sector is nevertheless a vitally important link in the Imperium, forming the major route between the Imperial Core and the Spinward Marches. Those from the core see the section as barbaric while those in the Marches view it as decadent and past its age. Home to one of the brightest stars in the entire galaxy, Deneb is a sector of wonder and fortune...

To use this supplement,a Referee will require the Traveller Core Rulebook.

130361.name: Phytocats
130361.description:
Phytocats is a card game where players nurture and hatch eggs into adorable cat-plant hybrids. Depending how the player cares for their eggs, they will hatch into different breeds of Phytocat. These creatures assist their owners and hinder their rivals.

Phytocats focuses on interactive, but not destructive, gameplay. Each player’s decisions are constantly influenced by the players around them, and a “first to achieve” system encourages players to diversify their strategies. This leads to rich, dynamic play where each player is striving to succeed using a wide variety of Phytocats.

While some game elements allow players to interfere with another player’s strategy, a player’s accomplishments cannot be taken away from them. The majority of play elements involve positive, helpful interactions.

Phytocats is looking for a publisher! If you are interested please contact phytocats@gmail.com!

130362.name: Diagonal Blocks
130362.description:
Diagonal Blocks is an abstract strategy game modeled after Blokus, and playable with a Blokus set. The pieces, (same as Blokus) consist of a complete set of all polyominoes up to size 5. The board is 20x20 (smaller in 2 or 3 player variants) with the six squares nearest each corner removed. Play begins at a starting square for each player, and each players subsequent move must contact his previously placed pieces only at a diagonal points. The game ends when no further pieces can be played. The winner is the player who covered the most squares with his pieces.

Vis-a-vis Blokus, the differences are:
(1) The corners are removed from the board so there are barely more squares on the board than pieces to be played.
(2) There are no special scoring bonuses. The count of squares covered is the entire score.
(3) In two player variants, A "swap" rule applies to the second move. This removes the first player advantage.

Variations:
Diagonal Blocks (3 player, intermediate size board)
Diagonal Blocks Duo (2 player)
Diagonal Blocks Classic (2 player, 4 color)

Online Play


BoardSpace (real-time, AI option)

130363.name: Tinkle Bavard #41
130363.description:
Petit d'homme, de Crisse et N'Guessan
Manque de chance
Eric, archange du Deo Gratias
Ach... Berlin!
L'Or de l'Atlantide
Les Smokers
Un village, des bandits, sept aventuriers
The Crow, de James O'Barr

130364.name: Tinkle Bavard #42
130364.description:
Rouge de Chine, de Thierry Robin
Vengeance d'outre-tombe
L'arbre du pendu
La bête
Mission de routine en territoire indien
Pour quelques bardes de plus
Utilisez votre groupe pour devenir puissant
Orion, de Masamune Shirow

130365.name: Tinkle Bavard #43
130365.description:
De Cape & de Crocs, d'Ayroles et Masbou
Les brumes du Ouatif
Pyrosorcier elfe
L'Alliance du Pic de l'Aigle
Un regrettable manque de courtoisie

130366.name: Tinkle Bavard #44
130366.description:
Largo Winch: les romans
L'orange sans pépins
Une jeune fille modèle
Retour à L'catraz-départ
La pierre de Nierbonchera
Jusqu'à ce que la mort nous sépare
Mon nom est personne
Ecologiste pacifiste
Star de bloodball

130367.name: Tinkle Bavard #45

rpg.4613: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)

130367.description:
Soda
Recherches chromatiques
Ouessant et les oiseaux de l'abbaye
Bienvenue sur Khelp
L'ambassadrice
Impérial rebelle
Sinistre assassin

130368.name: Tinkle Bavard #46
130368.description:
Maus, de Art Spiegelmann
Opération Dragon d'Or
La brocaderie et ses charmes
Le fantôme dans la machine
Le Conseil Supérieur Corporatif
Welcome to the WWN
Petit guide de la Technocratie
En direct de chez moi

130369.name: Tinkle Bavard #47
130369.description:
Arcanes, de Jean-Pierre Pécau
La fresque d'Oriane la Grise
Voyage vers l'inconnu
Premiers pas dans la Rébellion

Bellissandre
Carnets de notes
The X-Files of H.P. Lovecraft
Endymion, de Dan Simmons

130371.description:
Moult péripéties (suite)
Bellissandre (suite)
Une plume noire
Il était deux petits navires
Isaïe Mandelbaum

130372.name: Tinkle Bavard #50

La chose

La menace subliminale
Nie wieder

130373.description:
Edito
The Fort Rockyard
Pour autant que...
Stricnine
The putrescent seven
Château Drachenstein

130374.description:
Special issue containing articles for Rêve de Dragon previously published in the Tinkle Bavard

Stradivaria (aide de jeu)
Tic-Tac (scénario)
T'as pas du tabak? (scénario)
Le Pudding (scénario)
Les écailles du Dragon (scénario)
Le cor du délit (scénario)

Le Grand Pivier (scénario)

130375.description:
Special issue for Rêve de Dragon, continaing mostly previously unpublished article

Capistoliane (aide de jeu)
L'éclat du Morne-Rêve (campagne)
Comme un poisson dans l'eau (scénario)
Quand il y a de la chaîne (scénario)
Tel est pris (scénario)
Sur le bord de l'aile (scénario)
Le Grimoire d'Ulric (aide de jeu)

130376.description:

Caramer Laeralis (aide de jeu)
Europa (aide de jeu)
Asgard (aide de jeu)

Drogues (aide de jeu)

Le donjon de l'Oncle MacDonald (scénario)
La Dame de Fer saute sur Trian (scénario)
Retour au bercail (scénario)
Sprechen Sie Galactisch? (aide de jeu)

130377.name: Aerochamp
130377.description:
Aerochamp deals with a trans-Atlantic air race. Four players travel from the USA to Europe by balloon. The critical factors in the game are wind and gas.

The wind direction can be determined by the players using tactical cards. The quantity of gas needs to be managed carefully, as otherwise the balloon won't reach Europe and will plunge into the Atlantic Ocean.

Depending on the power and direction of the wind the players choose the optimal flying course. The players who is first to reach the destined port (in Europe) wins the game.

130379.name: Koekie Loeren: Het Kruipkoekie
130379.description:
Expansion to the game Koekie Loeren (Cookie Disco). Het kruipkoekie (the crawl cookie) is played on top of the cookies of the basis game. The crawl cookie itself has no point value, therefore a cookie that’s connected to the crawl cookie only, cannot be moved. A cookie that’s underneath the crawl cookie, has no point value as long as the crawl cookie is on top of it and no points are scored for a cookie that’s underneath the crawl cookie at the end of the game.

This small expansion gives the basis game even more tactical options and depth.

130380.name: Monopoly: Garmisch-Partenkirchen
130380.description:
Monopoly set of Garmisch-Partenkirchen, a German city at the northern edge of the Bavarian Alps.
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.

130381.name: The Land of Promise
130381.description:
From the back of the book:

Tír Tairngire Wants You!

Tír Tairngire has changed. The predominantly elven nation has an ork at its head, and the residents have become more welcoming to outsiders, in the sense that they don’t always immediately threaten to shoot them when they come in sight.

There is enough wealth and power in Tír Tairngire to make even the slightest crack in the nation’s façade tempting. Every shadowrunner knows that elves, especially powerful elves, do not rank high on the trustworthiness scale, but that doesn’t have to be a deal breaker.

Anticipating lies and betrayals from the people runners work with is part of the game. Runners should just be sure to gather critical information about getting in to the Tír, the major cities, and the dominant personalities before they go in, since forewarned is forearmed.

The Land of Promise is the resource runners need to get caught up on the current status of Tír Tairngire and its leaders. With adventure seeds, profiles of notable personalities, and essential demographic information, this is a critical resource for anyone living in or near the elven nation’s shadows.

The Land of Promise is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

130382.name: Chronicle of the Righteous
130382.description:
publisher blurb

Pray for Mercy
The empyreal lords watch over the infinite expanses of the multiverse to ensure that good can flourish and that evil, no matter its form, can be vanquished. But even these powers cannot stem the tide of evil by themselves, and they must often rely on their celestial servants—noble angels, wise agathions, unrelenting archons, and free-spirited azatas—to lead the charge against the forces of corruption. Together, these virtuous forces wage an unending war against the blasphemous and the profane, all the while lifting worthy mortals to stations of ever-greater glory among the boundless celestial spheres.

Inside this book, you’ll find:


A thorough exploration of over 50 empyreal lords, including details on their minions, the divine powers they bestow upon mortal worshipers, and the celestial realms from which they hail.
Rules for the mystery cultist prestige class and details on the various types of mystery cults.
Methods to bolster mortal spellcasters’ efforts while summoning all the different types of celestials.
New spells for spellcasters to hurl at their wicked foes and new magic items to aid adventurers in their battles against evil.
Rules for rituals of self-mortification and the divine powers that can be gleaned by such acts of devotion.
A bestiary of five new celestials to assist or oppose player characters, including the keen-eyed spyglass archon and the veranallia, azata master of seasons, growth, and decay.

130383.name: Another Lifeless Planet and Me With No Beer
130383.description:
A text adventure by Dennis Drew

Manual

If you have played MAROONED AGAIN, you are acquainted with our hapless hero. He wrecks space ships like you and I munch hamburgers. In Marooned Again, he found an alien ship and sent clones aboard to try and get the vessel to blast off and go for safety. Apparently he succeeded, because he's back again, and he's done it again.

By the way... he is you.

You have crashed your ship on a hostile alien planet. This one is REALLY hostile; you realize you've landed right in the middle of an alien security hive.
